meanings.definition: A person who encourages or assists someone in committing a crime or wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The abettors were caught red-handed at the scene of the crime.
meanings.sent2: The police arrested the abettors who helped the thief escape.
meanings.sent3: The abettors tried to hide the evidence but ended up making it more obvious.
meanings.sent4: The abettors were like shadows, always lurking in the background.
meanings.sent5: The abettors whispered sinister plans in the criminal's ear.

meanings.definition: Those who support or aid in a particular action or cause.
meanings.sent1: The abettors of the charity event worked tirelessly to raise funds.
meanings.sent2: The team of abettors cheered on their friend during the race.
meanings.sent3: The abettors organized a surprise party to show their appreciation.
meanings.sent4: The abettors were the backbone of the community, always lending a helping hand.
meanings.sent5: The abettors stood united, ready to face any challenge together.
